channel.title: Can you be on Server Status even though your hamachi?
channel.description: Just wondering, Sorry if its wrong section..

item.title: Can you be on Server Status even though your hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:7, topic:435168”][quote author=PureQuintinScape link=topic=537888.msg3934114#msg3934114 date=1330912704]
Well some people can’t port foward :]
[/quote]
Everyone can port forward, but it requires a little bit of knowledge and administrative access to your router/modem (depends if you modem is Bridged only or Bridged and PPPoE - which is a big mess). You can try going to www.Portfoward.com. There you can find port forwarding help for your router/modem and then find the game/application you are trying to open a specific port for.[/quote]
Yes, everyone can portforward (If they have a router.) It’s just that not everyone has the knowledge to do so.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you be on Server Status even though your hamachi?

item.title: Can you be on Server Status even though your hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

PureQuintinScape:

Well some people can’t port foward :]

Everyone can port forward, but it requires a little bit of knowledge and administrative access to your router/modem (depends if you modem is Bridged only or Bridged and PPPoE - which is a big mess). You can try going to www.Portfoward.com. There you can find port forwarding help for your router/modem and then find the game/application you are trying to open a specific port for.

Read full topic

No, and why would you use Hamachi, it’s retarded. Fun fact, Hamachi servers never last long.

So true!
[/quote]
Hey, mine lasted 3 days…before i switched to a vps. ;)[/quote]
exactly my point
